辞書にある屈折形と関連する文法上の時制を示す．
usage
contains usage information in a dictionary entry.
辞書項目中にある用例情報を示す．
@type
classifies the usage information using any convenient typology.
当該用例情報を分類する．
geographic
geographic area
地理的範囲．
temporal, historical era (archaic, old, etc.)
時代(古代，昔，など)．
domain
domain or subject matter (e.g. scientific, literary etc.)
分野，主題(科学，文学，など)．
register
style (figurative, literal, etc.)
スタイル(比喩的，字義的，など)．
preference level
preference level (chiefly, usually, etc.)
使用度(主たる，通常，など)．
language
name of a language mentioned in etymological or other linguistic discussion.
語源や他の言語学的解説に出てくる言語の名前．
grammatical
grammatical usage
文法上の用法．
synonym
synonym given to show use
同義語．
hypernym
hypernym given to show usage
上位語．
collocation
contains a collocate of the headword.
見出し語の連語関係．
complement
typical complement
一般的な補語．
object
typical object
一般的な目的語．
subject
typical subject
一般的な主語．
typical verb
一般的な動詞．
unclassifiable piece of information to guide sense choice
分類できない，意味を選択するための情報，
cross-reference phrase
contains a phrase, sentence, or icon referring the reader to some other location in this or another text.
利用者に，他の場所を表す句，文，図形を示す．
@type
indicates the type of cross reference, using any convenient typology.
相互参照の種類を示す．
synonym
cross reference for synonym information
同義情報向けの相互参照．
etymological
etymological information
語源情報．
compare or consult
related or similar term
関連語または似た言葉．
illustration
illustration of an object
対象の絵．
manuscript excerpt
provides attributes used to describe excerpts from a manuscript placed in a description thereof.
手書き資料からの引用を記述するための属性を示す．
@defective
indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage.
当該部分に問題があるかどうかを示す．例えば，欠損や損傷による不完 全さなど．
manuscript excerpt
provides attributes used to describe excerpts from a manuscript placed in a description thereof.
手書き資料からの引用を記述するための属性を示す．
@defective
indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage.
当該部分に問題があるかどうかを示す．例えば，欠損や損傷による不完 全さなど．
accompanying material

contains details of any significant additional material which may be closely associated with the manuscript being described, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments bound in with the manuscript at some earlier historical period.
当該手書き資料と関連する情 報の詳細を記述するための要素．例えば，当該手書き資料が書かれた時代と は異なる時期の文書や断片についてについての詳細を示す．例えば，当該手 書き資料が作成された以前に書かれた文書やその断片であったりするものに ついて．
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the process by which a manuscript or manuscript part entered the holding institution.
当該手書き資料が入手された経緯についての情報を示す．
groups additional information, combining bibliographic information about a manuscript, or surrogate copies of it with curatorial or administrative information.
当該手書き資料に関する書誌情報などの付随情報まとめる．または当該資料 の複製に関する管理情報をまとめる．
contains a description of any significant additions found within a manuscript, such as marginalia or other annotations.
当該手書き資料中にある，重要な付加物を示す．例えば，欄外の書き込みや 注釈など．
administrative information
contains information about the present custody and availability of the manuscript, and also about the record description itself.
当該手書き資料，またはその記録文書そのものの管理・利用形態についての情 報を示す．
alternative identifier
contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript, such as a former catalogue number.
当該手書き資料を示す，代わりとなるIDまたは昔のIDを示す．例えば，昔の カタログ番号など．
contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript.
1つの装訂に関する情報を示す．例えば，手書き資料でいうカバーの種類， 表紙など．
@contemporary
specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents
当該装訂が，当該内容の大部分と同年代のものかどうかを示す．
binding description
describes the present and former bindings of a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct binding elements, one for each binding of the manuscript.
手書き資料の現行または以前の装訂に関する情報を示す．一連の段落または 一連の要素bindingで示される．各単位が当該手書き資料の各装訂 に対応する．
describes the system used to ensure correct ordering of the quires making up a codex or incunable, typically by means of annotations at the foot of the page.
古典籍において，冊子や初期刊本の折丁の順番を正しくするために使用され るシステムを示す．一般には，ページの脚に注釈(つなぎことば)を記す．
contains a description of how the leaves or bifolia are physically arranged.
当該の葉または一度折られた折丁が，物理的にどのように構成されているか を示す．
contains the name of a collection of manuscripts, not necessarily located within a single repository.
手書き資料のコレクション名を示す．必ずしも一ヶ所に保管されている必要 はない．
contains the colophon of a manuscript item: that is, a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the manuscript.
当該手書き資料のコロフォン(奥付情報)を示す．例えば，制 作の日時，場所，主体，制作主体，制作理由など．
contains a description of the physical condition of the manuscript.
当該手書き資料の，物理的な状態を示す．
custodial event
describes a single event during the custodial history of a manuscript.
手書き資料の管理履歴における，ひとつの事象を示す．
custodial history
contains a description of a manuscript's custodial history, either as running prose or as a series of dated custodial events.
手書き資料の管理履歴を示す．散文形式または一連の日付つき履歴で示す．
decoration description
contains a description of the decoration of a manuscript, either as a sequence of paragraphs, or as a sequence of topically organised decoNote elements.
当該手書き資料の装飾を，一連の散文段落，または一連の要素 decoNoteで示す．
note on decoration
contains a note describing either a decorative component of a manuscript, or a fairly homogenous class of such components.
当該手書き資料の装飾要素またはそのようなものを示す．
specifies a length measured across the spine.
冊子の背と平行した深さを示す．
contains a dimensional specification.
大きさ・程度を示す．
@type
indicates which aspect of the object is being measured.
当該計測対象を示す．
dimensions relate to one or more leaves (e.g. a single leaf, a gathering, or a separately bound part)
葉の状態を示す．例えば，一葉，葉の丁合(折丁)，独立した一枚を まとめたもの，など．
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been ruled in preparation for writing.
書記の準備として罫が引かれている領域を示す．
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been pricked out in preparation for ruling (used where this differs significantly from the ruled area, or where the ruling is not measurable).
罫を引く準備として開けられた穴がある領域を示す．これは，罫付 き領域とも，罫が読み取れない領域とも異なる．

dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been written, with the height measured from the top of the minims on the top line of writing, to the bottom of the minims on the bottom line of writing.
書記領域を示す．先頭文字行から最終文字行までの高さ．
dimensions relate to the miniatures within the manuscript
当該手書き資料の彩飾図の大きさを示す．
dimensions relate to the binding in which the codex or manuscript is contained
冊子や写本全体の大きさを示す．
dimensions relate to the box or other container in which the manuscript is stored.
当該写本を入れるケースの大きさを示す．
contains the explicit of a manuscript item, that is, the closing words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it.
手書き資料の巻末語句(explicit)を示す．すなわち，当該テ キストの終了を示す語句のことである．これは，朱書き部分(rubric)やコロ フォン(奥付情報)とは異なる．
contains information concerning the manuscript's filiation, i.e. its relationship to other surviving manuscripts of the same text, its protographs, antigraphs and apographs.
手書き資料の親子関係，すなわち，同じテキストを持つ現存 する手書き資料と，その原本(protographs), 異本(antigraphs), 転写本(apographs)との関係．

contains the string of words that denotes the end of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, usually set off from the text itself by red ink, by a different size or type of script, or by some other such visual device.
テキスト部分の終わりを示す文字列を示す．その著者やタイトルを含むこと がある．一般には，テキスト中にある朱書きや，大きさや種類の異なる字体 など，異なる視覚効果で示されている．
describes the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages in a codex.
冊子における葉やページを数える付番システムを示す．
description of hands
contains a description of all the different kinds of writing used in a manuscript.
手書き資料にある異なる書記全てについての解説を示す．
@hands
specifies the number of distinct hands identified within the manuscript
当該手書き資料中で特定可能な筆致の数を示す．
contains a measurement measured along the axis parallel to the spine.
背に沿って計測された大きさを示す．
contains a heraldic formula or phrase, typically found as part of a blazon, coat of arms, etc.
紋章学的記述を含む．例えば，紋章記述や紋章など．
groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript or manuscript part.
手書き資料の歴史を表す要素をまとめる．

contains the incipit of a manuscript item, that is the opening words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric which might precede it, of sufficient length to identify the work uniquely; such incipts were, in fomer times, frequently used a means of reference to a work, in place of a title.
手書き資料の冒頭語句(incipit)を示す．冒頭語句とは，テキ ストの書き出しにある語句で，これに先行してある朱書き部分を除いた，当 該作品を特定するに充分な文量の部分である． 冒頭語句は，タイトル部分において，作品への参照を示す手段としてよく使 用されていた．
contains the name of an organization such as a university or library, with which a manuscript is identified, generally its holding institution.
手書き資料を特定する，一般にはそれを所蔵する大学や図書館といった組織 の名前を示す．
describes how text is laid out on the page, including information about any ruling, pricking, or other evidence of page-preparation techniques.
当該ページ上でテキストがどのようにレイアウトされているかを示す．例え ば，罫線，穴，などの書記支度技法．
@columns
specifies the number of columns per page
ページ中の段数を示す．
@ruledLines
specifies the number of ruled lines per column
1段中の罫の数を示す．
@writtenLines
specifies the number of written lines per colum
1段中の行数を示す．
layout description
collects the set of layout descriptions applicable to a manuscript.
手書き資料のレイアウト情報をまとめる．
defines a location within a manuscript or manuscript part, usually as a (possibly discontinuous) sequence of folio references.
手書き資料中の場所を定義する．一般には，(多くの場合不連続の)一連の折 丁参照による．
@scheme
identifies the foliation scheme in terms of which the location is being specified.
当該場所を指定するための折丁スキームを特定する．
@from
specifies the starting point of the location in a normalized form.
正規化された形で，当該場所の始点を示す．
@to
specifies the end-point of the location in a normalized form.
正規化された形で，当該場所の終点を示す．
@target
supplies a link to one or more transcriptions of the specified range of folios.
折丁の特定範囲にある，ひとつ以上の画像または転記データへのリンク を示す．
contains a word or phrase describing the material of which a manuscript (or part of a manuscript) is composed.
手書き資料を構成する素材を表す語句を示す．
manuscript contents
describes the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items.
手書き資料の知的内容を，一連の段落または一連の構造化された手書き資料 項目として示す．
@class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this object.
当該テキストの種類を示す．
manuscript description
contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript.
単一の識別可能な手書き資料の解説を示す．
manuscript identifier
contains the information required to identify the manuscript being described.
解説されている手書き資料を特定するために必要な情報を示す．
manuscript item
describes an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part.
手書き資料の知的内容の中に出現する，独立した作品または項目を示す．
@class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item
当該項目のテキストの種類を示す．
structured manuscript item
contains a structured description for an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part.
手書き資料の知的内容の中に出現する，独立した作品または項目の構造的解 説を示す．
@class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item
当該テキストの種類を示す．
alternative name
contains any form of unstructured alternative name used for a manuscript, such as an ocellus nominum, or nickname.
手書き資料を示す構造化されていない別名の形式を示す．例えば， ocellus nominumなどの愛称など．
manuscript part
contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or part of a manuscript, now forming part of a composite manuscript.
元々は別のものであったものを，新しくひとつにまとめ直された手書き資料 の情報を示す．
contains description of type of musical notation.
記譜法の種類を示す．
contains a description of the physical components making up the object which is being described.
当該対象の物理的構成要素の解説を示す．
@form
a short project-specific name identifying the physical form of the carrier, for example as a codex, roll, fragment, partial leaf, cutting etc.
当該キャリアの物理的な形を示す，プロジェクト固有の短い名前．例え ば，冊子，巻子，断片，切れ端など．
origin date
contains any form of date, used to identify the date of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part.
手書き資料が生まれた日付を特定するたための日付を示す．
origin place
contains any form of place name, used to identify the place of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part.
手書き資料が生まれた場所を特定するための場所を示す．
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the origin of a manuscript or manuscript part.
手書き資料の出自に関する解説や情報を示す．
physical description
contains a full physical description of a manuscript or manuscript part, optionally subdivided using more specialised elements from the model.physDescPart class.
手書き資料の物理的な解説を示す．選択的に，クラスmodel.physDescPartに ある要素に下位分解される．
contains any descriptive or other information concerning a single identifiable episode during the history of a manuscript or manuscript part, after its creation but before its acquisition.
手書き資料を入手するまでの歴史に関する，特定可能なエピソードに関する 情報を示す．
recorded history
provides information about the source and revision status of the parent manuscript description itself.
元になった手書き資料の，元や改訂に関する情報を示す．
contains the name of a repository within which manuscripts are stored, possibly forming part of an institution.
手書き資料が収められている収蔵館の名前を示す．恐らく，団体の名前の一 部である．

contains the text of any rubric or heading attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, a string of words through which a manuscript signals the beginning of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, which is in some way set off from the text itself, usually in red ink, or by use of different size or type of script, or some other such visual device.
朱書き部分，すなわち，手書き資料の見出し部分のテキスト を示す．手書き資料中にあるあるテキスト部分の始点を示すもので，よく著 者やタイトルが記されている．テキストとは異なって示されており，一般に は赤いインクで書かれている．または，異なる大きさや種類の字体が使われ るなど，ある視覚効果が使われている．
contains a description of one seal or similar attachment applied to a manuscript.
手書き資料にあるシールや付着物を示す．
@contemporary
specifies whether or not the seal is contemporary with the item to which it is affixed
当該シールが，当該資料と同時代のものかを示す．
seal description
describes the seals or other external items attached to a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct seal elements, possibly with additional decoNotes.
手書き資料に付属するシールや他の付着物について，一連の段落や，一連の 要素sealにより，可能であれば要素decoNoteと共に示す．
second folio
The word or words taken from a fixed point in a codex (typically the beginning of the second leaf) in order to provide a unique identifier for it.
ユニークな識別子を示すために，冊子中の特定点にある単語を示す．
contains discussion of the leaf or quire signatures found within a codex.
冊子における葉または折丁の記号に関する情報を示す．
describes the original source for the information contained with a manuscript description.
手書き資料にある，元資料に関する情報を示す．
contains a word or phrase describing a stamp or similar device.
印などにある語句を示す．
contains a brief summary of the intellectual content of an item, provided by the cataloguer.
カタログ作成者が提示した，いち項目の知的内容を簡単にまとめたものを示 す．
contains a description of the materials etc. which make up the physical support for the written part of a manuscript.
手書き資料でテキストが書かれている部分を作る物理的な素材に関する説明 を示す．
support description
groups elements describing the physical support for the written part of a manuscript.
手書き資料のテキスト部分を作る物理的な素材を示す要素をまとめる．
@material
a short project-defined name for the material composing the majority of the support
プロジェクトで定義した，素材を示す短い名前．
parchment
contains information about any digital or photographic representations of the manuscript being described which may exist in the holding institution or elsewhere.
手書き資料が電子化されたものまたは写真の表現に関する情報を示す．
text language
describes the languages and writing systems used by a manuscript (as opposed to its description, which is described in the langUsage element).
手書き資料中の言語や書記システムを示す．(要素langUsageにあ る情報と対位する)
@mainLang
main language
supplies a code which identifies the chief language used in the manuscript.
当該手書き資料中で主に使用される言語を特定するコードを示す．
@otherLangs
other languages
one or more codes identifying any other languages used in the manuscript.
当該手書き資料中で使用されている他の言語を特定する，ひとつ以上の コード．
contains a word or phrase describing a watermark or similar device.
すかし模様などを表す語句を示す．
contains a measurement measured along the axis perpendicular to the spine.
背に対して直角に計測される計測値を示す．
elements which can be positioned within a two dimensional coordinate system.
2次元座標システムによる，場所を示す要素．
@ulx
gives the x coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における左上点のX軸の値を示す．
@uly
gives the y coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における左上点のY軸の値を示す．
@lrx
gives the x coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における右下点のX軸の値を示す．
@lry
gives the y coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における右下点のY軸の値を示す．
groups elements corresponding with all or part of an image, because they contain an alternative representation of it, typically but not necessarily a transcription of it.
要素facsimileに含まれる画像や紙面に関する要素．
@facs
facsimile
points to all or part of an image which corresponds with the content of the element.
当該要素に対応する要素facsimileにある画像やその部分への 参照．
elements which can be positioned within a two dimensional coordinate system.
2次元座標システムによる，場所を示す要素．
@ulx
gives the x coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における左上点のX軸の値を示す．
@uly
gives the y coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における左上点のY軸の値を示す．
@lrx
gives the x coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における右下点のX軸の値を示す．
@lry
gives the y coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space.
矩形における右下点のY軸の値を示す．
groups elements corresponding with all or part of an image, because they contain an alternative representation of it, typically but not necessarily a transcription of it.
要素facsimileに含まれる画像や紙面に関する要素．
@facs
facsimile
points to all or part of an image which corresponds with the content of the element.
当該要素に対応する要素facsimileにある画像やその部分への 参照．
added span of text

cell.hi: No ja for "added span of text"

row.cell: marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text added by an author, scribe, annotator or corrector (see also add).
著者，筆写者，注釈者，校正者の手による長めの追加テキストを挿入する始 点を示す(addも参照のこと)．
abbreviation marker
contains a sequence of letters or signs present in an abbreviation which are omitted or replaced in the expanded form of the abbreviation.
当該省略形が，原形を省略またはそれに代わったことを示す文字列または記 号列．
contains an area of damage to the text witness.
当該文献におけるテキストの損傷部分を示す．
damaged span of text

cell.hi: No ja for "damaged span of text"

row.cell: marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text which is damaged in some way but still legible.
読める程度の損傷がある，一連のテキストの始点を示す．
deleted span of text
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise signaled as superfluous or spurious by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
著者・筆写者・注釈者・校正者により，削除または削除として符号化または 余分なものまたは間違いとして示されている，長めのテキスト部分の始点を 示す．
editorial expansion
contains a sequence of letters added by an editor or transcriber when expanding an abbreviation.
編集者や転記者が，省略形を元に戻した結果の文字列を示す．
contains a representation of some written source in the form of a set of images rather than as transcribed or encoded text.
転記または符号化されたテキストではなく，画像データ中にある，書記資料の 表現を示す．
forme work
contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page.
版面の周りにある柱やノンブルを示す．
@type
classifies the material encoded according to some useful typology.
符号化された当該部分を分類する．
a running title at the top of the page
天にタイトル．
a running title at the bottom of the page
地にあるタイトル．
page number
a page number or foliation symbol
ノンブル．
line number
a line number, either of prose or poetry
韻文・散文における行番号．
signature
a signature or gathering symbol
折丁記号．
catchword
a catch-word
柱．
contains one or more handNote elements documenting the different hands identified within the source texts.
元資料にある特定可能な筆致を記録する，ひとつ以上の要素 handNoteを示す．
marks the beginning of a sequence of text written in a new hand, or the beginning of a scribal stint.
テキストにおける新しい筆致の始まり，または筆写者の仕事の開始を示す．
@new
identifies the new hand.
当該新しい筆致を特定する．
@resp
signifies the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the change of hand.
筆致の変化を特定した責任のある編集者や転記者を特定する．
indicates restoration of text to an earlier state by cancellation of an editorial or authorial marking or instruction.
編集者や著者による指示を覆し，以前の状態のテキストを復元することを示 す．
indicates the location of a significant space in the copy text.
元資料にある重要な空白の場所を示す．
@dim
dimension
indicates whether the space is horizontal or vertical.
当該空白は，縦長か横長かを示す．
the space is horizontal.
当該空白は，横長．
the space is vertical.
当該空白は，縦長．
@resp
responsible party
indicates the individual responsible for identifying and measuring the space.
当該空白を特定し測った責任のある人物を示す．
substitution
groups one or more deletions with one or more additions when the combination is to be regarded as a single intervention in the text.
追加と削除が一連の調整と考えられる場合，そのひとつ以上の追加部分や削 除部分をまとめる．
signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason, typically because the original cannot be read because of physical damage or loss to the original.
転記者や編集者にひょって付加されたテキストを示す．例えば，元のテキス トが物理的損傷や欠損から判読できない場合などに付加されるもの．
@reason
indicates why the text has had to be supplied.
当該テキストが付加された理由を示す．
defines a written surface in terms of a rectangular coordinate space, optionally grouping one or more graphic representations of that space, and rectangular zones of interest within it.
矩形の座標により，書記の表面を定義する．選択的に，空間や矩形範囲中のひ とつ以上の図表表現をまとめる．
@start
points to an element which encodes the starting position of the text corresponding to the inscribed part of the surface.
刻字されたテキストの始点を表す要素を指示する．
defines a rectangular area contained within a surface element.
要素surfaceにある表面上の矩形範囲を定義する．
attributes for elements which mark the beginning or ending of a fragmentary manuscript or other witness.
手書き資料や文献の断片について，その初めと終わりを示す要素向けの 属性．
@wit
witness or witnesses
contains a list of one or more sigla indicating the witnesses which begin or end at this point.
ひとつ以上の文献記号のリストを含む． 当該ポインタにより文献記号で示された文献の始めまたは終わりが示さ れている．
defines a set of attributes common to all elements representing variant readings in text critical work.
校勘資料における解釈を示す要素全てに付与される属性を定義する．
@wit
witness or witnesses
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the witnesses which attest to a given reading.
当該解釈を証す文献を示す1つ以上のポインタのリストを示す．
@type
classifies the reading according to some useful typology.
当該解釈の分類を示す．
the reading offers a substantive variant.
当該解釈は，実質的な異形を示す．
the reading differs only orthographically, not in substance, from other readings.
当該解釈は，実質的なものではないが，他の解釈の正書法と異なる．
@cause
classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins.
解釈が異なる原因を分類する．
@varSeq
variant sequence
provides a number indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence to the variants on any one lemma.
1つの対象語に対する一連の異形を想定する理由がある場合，当該解釈 がある場所を番号で示す．
@resp
responsible party
identifies the editor responsible for asserting a particular reading in the witness.
当該文献にある特定の解釈に責任のある編集者を示す．
@hand
signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in the witness.
当該文献における特定の解釈に責任を持つ筆致を示す．
attributes for elements which mark the beginning or ending of a fragmentary manuscript or other witness.
手書き資料や文献の断片について，その初めと終わりを示す要素向けの 属性．
@wit
witness or witnesses
contains a list of one or more sigla indicating the witnesses which begin or end at this point.
ひとつ以上の文献記号のリストを含む． 当該ポインタにより文献記号で示された文献の始めまたは終わりが示さ れている．
defines a set of attributes common to all elements representing variant readings in text critical work.
校勘資料における解釈を示す要素全てに付与される属性を定義する．
@wit
witness or witnesses
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the witnesses which attest to a given reading.
当該解釈を証す文献を示す1つ以上のポインタのリストを示す．
@type
classifies the reading according to some useful typology.
当該解釈の分類を示す．
the reading offers a substantive variant.
当該解釈は，実質的な異形を示す．
the reading differs only orthographically, not in substance, from other readings.
当該解釈は，実質的なものではないが，他の解釈の正書法と異なる．
@cause
classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins.
解釈が異なる原因を分類する．
@varSeq
variant sequence
provides a number indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence to the variants on any one lemma.
1つの対象語に対する一連の異形を想定する理由がある場合，当該解釈 がある場所を番号で示す．
@resp
responsible party
identifies the editor responsible for asserting a particular reading in the witness.
当該文献にある特定の解釈に責任のある編集者を示す．
@hand
signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in the witness.
当該文献における特定の解釈に責任を持つ筆致を示す．
apparatus entry
contains one entry in a critical apparatus, with an optional lemma and at least one reading.
校勘資料中のいち対象で，内容として少なくとも1つの読みと，選択的に見 出し(lemma)をとる．
@type
classifies the variation contained in this element according to some convenient typology.
当該要素で示される対象を分類する．
@from
identifies the beginning of the lemma in the base text, if necessary.
必要であれば，元テキストにおける対象語(lemma)の開始点を示す．
@to
identifies the endpoint of the lemma in the base text, if necessary.
必要であれば，元テキストにおける対象語(lemma)語の終点を示す．
@loc
location
indicates the location of the variation, when the location-referenced method of apparatus markup is used.
校勘資料で場所参照の手法が採られている場合，該当する異なりの場所 を示す．
indicates the end of a lacuna in a mostly complete textual witness.
殆ど完全である文献中にある脱文の終わりを示す．
indicates the beginning of a lacuna in the text of a mostly complete textual witness.
殆ど完全である文献にある脱文の始めを示す．
lemma
contains the lemma, or base text, of a textual variation.
異なるテキストにおける対象語，すなわち基底テキスト(base text)を示す．
witness list
lists definitions for all the witnesses referred to by a critical apparatus, optionally grouped hierarchically.
校勘資料中で参照されている文献の定義のリストを示す．選択的に，グルー プとして構造化されている．
reading
contains a single reading within a textual variation.
異なるテキスト中で，ひとつの読みを示す．
reading group
within a textual variation, groups two or more readings perceived to have a genetic relationship or other affinity.
異なるテキストで，系統関係や類縁性があるとされる，二つ以上の読みをま とめる．
declares the method used to encode text-critical variants.
校勘対象を符号化する手法を示す．
@method
indicates which method is used to encode the apparatus of variants.
異なる校勘資料を符号化する手法を示す．
apparatus uses line numbers or other canonical reference scheme referenced in a base text.
校勘資料の基底テキスト中には，参照される行番号または標準的 な参照スキームがある．
apparatus indicates the precise locations of the beginning and ending of each lemma relative to a base text.
校勘資料の基底テキスト上にある各校合部分の始点と終点の正確な 場所が示されている．
alternate readings of a passage are given in parallel in the text; no notion of a base text is necessary.
ある一節の別の解釈が，当該テキスト中に併置されている．基底テ キストという視点は必要なくなる．
@location
indicates whether the apparatus appears within the running text or external to it.
校合の情報が，本文中，または外部にあるかを示す．
apparatus appears within the running text.
校合の情報は，本文中にある．
apparatus appears outside the base text.
校合の情報は，本文外，すなわち基底テキスト外にある．
contains a list of one or more sigla of witnesses attesting a given reading, in a textual variation.
読みの元となる文献を表すひとつ以上の文献記号のリストを示す．
witness detail
gives further information about a particular witness, or witnesses, to a particular reading.
特定の解釈に関連する，特定の文献について詳細な情報を示す．
@target
indicates the identifier for the reading, or readings, to which the witness detail refers.
当該文献細目が関連する解釈の識別子を示す．
@resp
responsible party
identifies the individual responsible for identifying the witness
当該文献を特定する責任のある人物を示す．
@wit
witnesses
indicates the sigil or sigla for the witnesses to which the detail refers.
細目が参照する当該文献の印や文献記号を示す．
@type
describes the type of information given about the witness.
当該文献に関する情報の種類を示す．
fragmented witness end
indicates the end, or suspension, of the text of a fragmentary witness.
断片的な文献のテキストの終わりまたは停止点を示す．
fragmented witness start
indicates the beginning, or resumption, of the text of a fragmentary witness.
断片的な文献のテキストの始点または再開点を示す．
contains either a description of a single witness referred to within the critical apparatus, or a list of witnesses which is to be referred to by a single sigil.
校勘資料で参照されている文献ひとつの情報，またはひとつの印が参照して いる文献のリストを示す．
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events using the ISO 8601 standard.
ISO8601に従い，時間事象の正規的方法を示す属性を示す．
@when-iso
supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.
日付や時間を，標準形式で示す．
@notBefore-iso
specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
当該事象の一番古い日付を，標準形式で示す．例えば，yyyy-mm-dd．
@notAfter-iso
specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
当該事象の一番新しい日付を，標準形式で示す．例えば，yyyy-mm-dd．
@from-iso
indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.
当該時間幅の，始点を標準形で示す．
@to-iso
indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.
当該時間幅の，終点を標準形で示す．
attributes for recording normalized temporal durations.
正規化された時間幅を記す属性．
@dur-iso
duration
indicates the length of this element in time.
当該時間の長さを示す．
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events using the ISO 8601 standard.
ISO8601に従い，時間事象の正規的方法を示す属性を示す．
@when-iso
supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.
日付や時間を，標準形式で示す．
@notBefore-iso
specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
当該事象の一番古い日付を，標準形式で示す．例えば，yyyy-mm-dd．
@notAfter-iso
specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
当該事象の一番新しい日付を，標準形式で示す．例えば，yyyy-mm-dd．
@from-iso
indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.
当該時間幅の，始点を標準形で示す．
@to-iso
indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.
当該時間幅の，終点を標準形で示す．
attributes for recording normalized temporal durations.
正規化された時間幅を記す属性．
@dur-iso
duration
indicates the length of this element in time.
当該時間の長さを示す．
additional name
contains an additional name component, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name.
付加的な名前要素を示す．例えば，愛称，渾名，別名などの個人名．
contains an informal description of a person's present or past affiliation with some organization, for example an employer or sponsor.
人物が所属している，またはしていた団体に関する情報を示す．例えば，雇 い主や出資者など．
specifies the age of a person.
人物の年齢を示す．
@value
supplies a numeric code representing the age or age group
年齢または年齢層を数値で示す．
contains information about a person's birth, such as its date and place.
人物の出生に関する情報を示す．例えば，日時や場所など．
contains the name of a geo-political unit consisting of two or more nation states or countries.
複数の国や地域を跨ぐ地政学的な名前を示す．
contains information about the physical climate of a place.
ある場所の天候に関する情報を示す．
contains the name of a geo-political unit, such as a nation, country, colony, or commonwealth, larger than or administratively superior to a region and smaller than a bloc.
1つの国家に相当する地政学的な単位名を示す．国家，植民地，共同体・連 邦を含む．これは，行政単位上の地域よりも大きい単位で，連合より小さな 単位である．
contains information about a person's death, such as its date and place.
人物の死亡に関する情報を示す．例えば，日付や場所など．
contains the name of any kind of subdivision of a settlement, such as a parish, ward, or other administrative or geographic unit.
場所を示す要素として，集落より小さい名前を示す．例えば，小教区や区な ど，行政上・地勢上の単位．
contains a description of the educational experience of a person.
人物の学歴を示す．
contains data relating to any kind of significant event associated with a person, place, or organization.
人生における特定の重要事象の解説を示す．
@where
indicates the location of an event by pointing to a place element

cell.hi: No ja for "indicates the location of an event by pointing to a place element"

row.cell: specifies the faith, religion, or belief set of a person.
人物の信仰・宗教を示す．
contains information about a person's period of activity.
人物が活躍した時期に関する情報を示す．
contains a forename, given or baptismal name.
人物に与えられた名前のうち，名の部分，すなわち個人を表す部分を示す．
generational name component
contains a name component used to distinguish otherwise similar names on the basis of the relative ages or generations of the persons named.
似た名前を区別する為に，相対的な年齢関係，世代関係などの情報を示す．
geographical coordinates
contains any expression of a set of geographic coordinates, representing a point, line, or area on the surface of the earth in some notation.
地球上の一点，線，領域を表すための，地理上の座標を示す．
geographical feature name
contains a common noun identifying some geographical feature contained within a geographic name, such as valley, mount, etc.
地理上の名前，例えば，谷，山などに含まれている地物を特定する名前を示 す．
geographical name
a name associated with some geographical feature such as Windrush Valley or Mount Sinai.
ウィンドラッシュ峡谷，シナイ山などの地理的特性に関する名前．
@type
provides more culture- linguistic- or application- specific information used to categorize this name component.
当該名前を分類するための，文化的，言語的，ソフトウェア依存の情報 を示す．
language knowledge
summarizes the state of a person's linguistic knowledge, either as prose or by a list of langKnown elements.
個人の言語学的知識を散文または要素langKnownのリストでまとめ る．
@tags
supplies one or more valid language tags for the languages specified
ひとつ以上の言語を示す．
language known
summarizes the state of a person's linguistic competence, i.e., knowledge of a single language.
個人の言語能力を示す．すなわち，単一言語の知識を示す．
@tag
supplies a valid language tag for the language concerned.
当該言語を，言語コードで示す．
@level
a code indicating the person's level of knowledge for this language
個人レベルの知識を示す言語コード．
list of canonical names

cell.hi: No ja for "list of canonical names"

row.cell: contains a list of nyms, that is, standardized names for any thing.
別名，すなわち，一般的に使われている名前のリストを示す．
list of organizations
contains a list of elements, each of which provides information about an identifiable organization.
特定可能な団体に関する情報を示す解説のリストを示す．
list of persons

contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable person or a group of people, for example the participants in a language interaction, or the people referred to in a historical source.
特定可能な個人やグループに関する情報のリストを示す．例えば，言語交流 の参加者や，歴史資料中で参照される人物など．
list of places
contains a list of places, optionally followed by a list of relationships (other than containment) defined amongst them.
場所のリストを示す．選択的に，場所間の(包含関係ではなく)関連性を 示すリストが続く．
defines the location of a place as a set of geographical coordinates, in terms of a other named geo-political entities, or as an address.
地理上の座標集合，地政学上の名前付き実体，アドレスなどにより場所を定 義する．
contains a connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it, such as van der or of.
名前の中で使われているが，その一部としては見られない，関連する句やリ ンクを示す．例えば，van derや ofなど．
contains an informal description of a person's present or past nationality or citizenship.
人物の国籍や市民権の形式的でない解説を示す．
canonical name
contains the definition for a canonical name or namepart of any kind.
各種名前の，標準的な名前または名前の部分の定義を示す．
@parts
points to constituent nyms
構成別名を参照する．
contains an informal description of a person's trade, profession or occupation.
人物の仕事や職業の，形式的でない説明を示す．
@scheme
identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use by supplying the identifier of a taxonomy element elsewhere in the header.
ヘダー内にある要素taxonomyの識別子により，使われている 分類システムを示す．
@code
identifies an occupation code defined within the classification system or taxonomy defined by the scheme attribute.
属性schemeで定義されている分類システムの中で定義され る仕事コードを示す．
that part of a relative temporal or spatial expression which indicates the direction of the offset between the two place names, dates, or times involved in the expression.
当該表現に含まれている2つの場所名，日付，時間のオフセットの方向を示 す，相対的な時空表現の部分を示す．
organization
provides information about an identifiable organization such as a business, a tribe, or any other grouping of people.
特定可能な団体の情報を示す．例えば，会社，集団など，人の集まり．
@role
specifies a primary role or classification for the organization.
当該組織の，第一位の役割または分類を示す．
organization name
contains an organizational name.
組織の名前を示す．
personal name
contains a proper noun or proper-noun phrase referring to a person, possibly including any or all of the person's forenames, surnames, honorifics, added names, etc.
人物の固有名詞を示す．例えば，名，姓，敬称，追加名など．
provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source.
特定可能な個人の情報を示す．例えば，言語交流の参加者，歴史資料中で参 照される人物など．
@role
specifies a primary role or classification for the person.
当該人物の第一位の役割や分類を示す．
@sex
specifies the sex of the person.
当該人物の性別を示す．
@age
specifies an age group for the person.
当該人物の年齢層を示す．
personal group
describes a group of individuals treated as a single person for analytic purposes.
分析上，ひとりの人物として扱われる，個人のグループを示す．
@role
specifies the role of this group of participants in the interaction.
交流の参加者から成る当該グループの役割を示す．
@sex
specifies the sex of the participant group.
参加者グループの性別を示す．
@age
specifies the age group of the participants.
当該参加者の年齢層を示す．
@size
specifies the size or approximate size of the group.
当該グループのおよその大きさを示す．
contains data about a geographic location
地理上の場所のデータを示す．
contains an absolute or relative place name.
絶対的，相対的場所名を示す．
contains information about the population of a place.
ある場所の人口に関する情報を示す．
contains the name of an administrative unit such as a state, province, or county, larger than a settlement, but smaller than a country.
行政上の単位の名前を示す．例えば，地方，郡，居住地など．居住地よりも 広く，国家より狭い地域．
relationship
describes any kind of relationship or linkage amongst a specified group of participants.
指定された参加者グループ間の関連性の種類を示す．
@type
categorizes the relationship in some respect, e.g. as social, personal or other.
当該関係を分類する．例えば，社会的関係，個人的関係など．
relationship concerned with social roles
社会的役割を伴う関係．
relationship concerned with personal roles, e.g. kinship, marriage, etc.
個人的役割を伴う関係．例えば，親類，婚姻など．
other kinds of relationship
他の関係．
@name
supplies a name for the kind of relationship of which this is an instance.
当該関係の種類名を示す．
@active
identifies the active participants in a non-mutual relationship, or all the participants in a mutual one.

cell.hi: No ja for "identifies the active participants in a non-mutual relationship, or all the participants in a mutual one."

row.cell: @mutual
supplies a list of participants amongst all of whom the relationship holds equally.

cell.hi: No ja for "supplies a list of participants amongst all of whom the relationship holds equally."

row.cell: @passive
identifies the passive participants in a non-mutual relationship.
一方向の関係における受動的な参加者を指定す る．
relation group
provides information about relationships identified amongst people, places, and organizations, either informally as prose or as formally expressed relation links.
人，場所，組織間の関係に関する情報を，散文またはリンクによる形式的表 現で示す．
residence
describes a person's present or past places of residence.
人物の，現在または過去の住居を示す．
contains a name component which indicates that the referent has a particular role or position in society, such as an official title or rank.
参照されるものの，社会的な役割や地位，例えば，公式な役職名や地位など を示す，名前要素を示す
contains the name of a settlement such as a city, town, or village identified as a single geo-political or administrative unit.
地政学上または行政上の単位としてある市，街，村などの居住地の名前を示 す．
specifies the sex of a person.
人物の性別を示す．
@value
socio-economic status
contains an informal description of a person's perceived social or economic status.
ある個人の，社会的・経済的状態を示す，形式的でない解説を示す．
@scheme
identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use.
使われた分類システムを示す．
@code
identifies a status code defined within the classification system or taxonomy defined by the source attribute.
属性sourceで定義された分類システムにある，状態コード を特定する．
contains a description of some status or quality attributed to a person, place, or organization at some specific time.
人物，場所，組織などの，現在の社会的状態や地位を示す．
contains a family (inherited) name, as opposed to a given, baptismal, or nick name.
(継承される)苗字を示す．姓名中の名，洗礼名，愛称，別称とは異なる．
contains information about the physical terrain of a place.
場所の地形情報を示す．
contains a description of some culturally-determined and in principle unchanging characteristic attributed to a person or place .
人物や場所の文化的な特性を示す．
contains one cell of a table.
表中のひとつのセルを示す．
description of figure
contains a brief prose description of the appearance or content of a graphic figure, for use when documenting an image without displaying it.
図表の内容や現れ方について簡単な散文で解説を示す．当該図表を示さない で記録する場合に使用される．
groups elements representing or containing graphic information such as an illustration or figure.
図表を示すまたは含む要素をまとめる．
contains a mathematical or other formula.
数式を示す．
@notation
supplies the name of a previously defined notation used for the content of the element.
当該要素の内容にある既定表記法の名前を示す．
contains one row of a table.
表の1行を示す．
contains text displayed in tabular form, in rows and columns.
表形式で示されるテキストを，行と列で示す．
@rows
indicates the number of rows in the table.
当該表中の行数を示す．
@cols
columns
indicates the number of columns in each row of the table.
当該表中の列数を示す．
contains a brief informal description of what a participant in a language interaction is doing other than speaking, if anything.
言語交流の参加者が行った発話以外の活動を示す．
primary channel
テキストが収録・伝搬されている媒体を示す．例えば，書かれてあるテキス トであれば，印刷本，原稿，eメールなどで，発話されたテキストであれば， ラジオ，電話，直接会話など．
@mode
specifies the mode of this channel with respect to speech and writing.
発話や書記の伝搬経路の種類を示す．
spoken
written
spoken to be written
e.g. dictation
発話されたものを書いたもの．例えば書き起こしなど．
written to be spoken
e.g. a script
書かれたものを発話したもの．例えば，台本など．
mixed
unknown or inapplicable
describes the internal composition of a text or text sample, for example as fragmentary, complete, etc.
テキストの内部構造を示す．例えば，部分的，完全など．
@type
specifies how the text was constituted.
当該テキストの構成状況を示す．
a single complete text
完全な1つのテキスト．
a text made by combining several smaller items, each individually complete
個々に完全である幾つかのテキストを部分テキストとして構成され ているテキスト．
fragments
a text made by combining several smaller, not necessarily complete, items
個々には完全である必要はない幾つかのテキストから構成されてい るテキスト．
composition unknown or unspecified
構成状況は不明または不定．
describes the nature and extent of originality of this text.
当該テキストの真性度を示す．
@type
categorizes the derivation of the text.
当該テキストの起源の分類を示す．
text is original
当該テキストはオリジナルである．
text is a revision of some other text
当該テキストは，他のテキストを元にした改訂である．
text is a translation of some other text
当該テキストは，他のテキストを翻訳したものである．
text is an abridged version of some other text
当該テキストは，他のテキストを簡約したものである．
text is plagiarized from some other text
当該テキストは，他のテキストを剽窃したものである．
text has no obvious source but is one of a number derived from some common ancestor
当該テキストは，元資料が不明であるが，何かしらを元にたテキス トである．
domain of use
describes the most important social context in which the text was realized or for which it is intended, for example private vs. public, education, religion, etc.
当該テキストの出現に関する最も重要な社会的状況を示す．例えば，私的， 公的，教育上，宗教上など．
@type
categorizes the domain of use.
当該社会的状況の分類を示す．
art and entertainment
芸術，娯楽．
domestic and private
家庭内，私的．
religious and ceremonial
宗教，儀式．
business and work place
仕事，職場．
education
教育．
government
government and law
政府，法律．
other forms of public context
その他の公的なもの．
describes the extent to which the text may be regarded as imaginative or non-imaginative, that is, as describing a fictional or a non-fictional world.
当該テキストの現実度を示す．例えば，フィクション，ノンフィクションなど．
@type
categorizes the factuality of the text.
当該現実度の分類を示す．
the text is to be regarded as entirely imaginative
当該テキストは，想像の産物である．
the text is to be regarded as entirely informative or factual
当該テキストは，事実的なものである．
the text contains a mixture of fact and fiction
当該テキストは，フィクション，ノンフィクションが混在している．
the fiction/fact distinction is not regarded as helpful or appropriate to this text
フィクション，ノンフィクションの区別は問題にならない．
describes the extent, cardinality and nature of any interaction among those producing and experiencing the text, for example in the form of response or interjection, commentary, etc.
当該テキストの生成に関わった人たちによる相互作用の程度，濃度，性質を 示す．例えば，応答，合いの手，コメントなど．
@type
specifies the degree of interaction between active and passive participants in the text.
当該テキストにおける参加者間の相互作用の程度を示す．
no interaction of any kind, e.g. a monologue
相互作用ではない．例えば，独白など．
some degree of interaction, e.g. a monologue with set responses
ある程度の相互作用．例えば，反応する人がいる状況での独白など．
complete interaction, e.g. a face to face conversation
完全なる相互作用．例えば，直接対話など．
this parameter is inappropriate or inapplicable in this case
当該パラメータは，不適切，または使用が相応しくない．
@active
specifies the number of active participants (or addressors) producing parts of the text.
当該テキストの生成に関わる能動的参加者の人数を示す．
a single addressor
個人の参加者．
many addressors
複数の参加者．
a corporate addressor
団体としての参加者．
number of addressors unknown or unspecifiable
参加者は不明または特定不可能．
@passive
specifies the number of passive participants (or addressees) to whom a text is directed or in whose presence it is created or performed.
当該テキストの生成に関わる受動的参加者の人数を示す．
text is addressed to the originator e.g. a diary
テキストは作成者に向けられたもの．例えば，日記など．
text is addressed to one other person e.g. a personal letter
テキストは他の人物に向けられたもの．例えば，個人書簡など．
text is addressed to a countable number of others e.g. a conversation in which all participants are identified
テキストは可算のその他のもの．例えば，全参加者が特定できる会 話など．
text is addressed to an undefined but fixed number of participants e.g. a lecture
テキストは人数が特定数である参加者に向けられたもの．例えば， 講義など．
text is addressed to an undefined and indeterminately large number e.g. a published book
テキストは，その規模が判らない程の多数に向けられたもの．例え ば，出版書籍など．
contains a brief informal description of the kind of place concerned, for example: a room, a restaurant, a park bench, etc.
場所の性質を表す簡単な情報を示す．例えば，部屋，レストラン，公園のベ ンチなど．
participation description
describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in a linguistic interaction.
言語交流における，特定可能な発話者，声，その他の参加者を示す．
describes the extent to which a text may be regarded as prepared or spontaneous.
テキストが準備されたものか，即興的なものかの程度を示す．
@type
a keyword characterizing the type of preparedness.
即興度の種類を示すキーワード．
spontaneous or unprepared
即興または準備されていない．
follows a script
台本に従う．
follows a predefined set of conventions
事前の打ち合わせに従う．
polished or revised before presentation
事前の準備が練り直しまたは修正されている．
characterizes a single purpose or communicative function of the text.
当該テキストの目的や伝達に関する機能の性質を示す．
@type
specifies a particular kind of purpose.
目的の種類を示す．
didactic, advertising, propaganda, etc.
教育，広報，宣伝など．
self expression, confessional, etc.
自己表現，独白など．
convey information, educate, etc.
情報伝達，教育など．
amuse, entertain, etc.
娯楽，エンターテイメントなど．
@degree
specifies the extent to which this purpose predominates.
当該目的が及ぶ範囲を示す．
describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place.
言語交流が行われたひとつの状況設定を示す．
setting description
describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, either as a prose description or as a series of setting elements.
言語交流が行われた状況設定を，散文または一連の要素settingに より示す．
text description
provides a description of a text in terms of its situational parameters.
状況パラメータにより，テキストの情報を示す．
defines a set of attributes for hypertext and other linking, which are enabled for all elements when the additional tag set for linking is selected.
リンクに関する付加的タグが使用される場合，全ての要素に付与可能な，リ ンクやハイパーテキストのための属性を定義する．
@corresp
corresponds
points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.
当該要素と対応する要素を示す．
@synch
synchronous
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.
当該要素と連動する要素を示す．
@sameAs
points to an element that is the same as the current element.
当該要素と同一の要素を示す．
@copyOf
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.
当該要素のコピー要素を示す．
@next
points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.
当該要素も所属する仮想集合における次の要素を示す．
@prev
previous
points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.
当該要素も所属する仮想集合における前の要素を示す．
@exclude
points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element.
当該要素の代替要素を示す．
@select

selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected.
ひとつ以上の選択肢を選ぶ．ひとつの選択肢が選ばれる場合，その曖昧 度や不確実度が示される．複数の選択肢が選ばれる場合，選ばれなかっ た選択肢の数から還元される，曖昧度や不確実度が示される．
defines a set of attributes used by all elements which point to other elements by means of one or more URI references.
URIにより要素を参照する要素に共通して付与される属性を定義する．
@type
categorizes the pointer in some respect, using any convenient set of categories.
当該ポインタの種類を示す．
@evaluate
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.
当該ポインタの参照先がポインタである場合，その意図を示す．
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer.
参照先の要素がポインターである場合，そのポインターの参照先へ と展開する．これを，参照先がポインターでなくなるまで続ける．
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer.
参照先の要素がポインターである場合，(そのポインターの参照先 がどうであれ)そのポインターが参照先になる．
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target.
当該ポインターの参照先から先にあるリンクへの展開は行わない．
defines a set of attributes common to all elements which enclose groups of pointer elements.
ポインタとなる要素に共通の属性を示す．
@domains
optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie.
当該要素の中にある全要素を対象とした識別子を選択的に指定する．
@targFunc
target function
describes the function of each of the values of the targets attribute of the enclosed link, join, or alt tags.
要素link, join, altに付与された属性 targetsの値の機能を示す．
defines a set of attributes for hypertext and other linking, which are enabled for all elements when the additional tag set for linking is selected.
リンクに関する付加的タグが使用される場合，全ての要素に付与可能な，リ ンクやハイパーテキストのための属性を定義する．
@corresp
corresponds
points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.
当該要素と対応する要素を示す．
@synch
synchronous
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.
当該要素と連動する要素を示す．
@sameAs
points to an element that is the same as the current element.
当該要素と同一の要素を示す．
@copyOf
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.
当該要素のコピー要素を示す．
@next
points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.
当該要素も所属する仮想集合における次の要素を示す．
@prev
previous
points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.
当該要素も所属する仮想集合における前の要素を示す．
@exclude
points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element.
当該要素の代替要素を示す．
@select

selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected.
ひとつ以上の選択肢を選ぶ．ひとつの選択肢が選ばれる場合，その曖昧 度や不確実度が示される．複数の選択肢が選ばれる場合，選ばれなかっ た選択肢の数から還元される，曖昧度や不確実度が示される．
defines a set of attributes used by all elements which point to other elements by means of one or more URI references.
URIにより要素を参照する要素に共通して付与される属性を定義する．
@type
categorizes the pointer in some respect, using any convenient set of categories.
当該ポインタの種類を示す．
@evaluate
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.
当該ポインタの参照先がポインタである場合，その意図を示す．
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer.
参照先の要素がポインターである場合，そのポインターの参照先へ と展開する．これを，参照先がポインターでなくなるまで続ける．
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer.
参照先の要素がポインターである場合，(そのポインターの参照先 がどうであれ)そのポインターが参照先になる．
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target.
当該ポインターの参照先から先にあるリンクへの展開は行わない．
defines a set of attributes common to all elements which enclose groups of pointer elements.
ポインタとなる要素に共通の属性を示す．
@domains
optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie.
当該要素の中にある全要素を対象とした識別子を選択的に指定する．
@targFunc
target function
describes the function of each of the values of the targets attribute of the enclosed link, join, or alt tags.
要素link, join, altに付与された属性 targetsの値の機能を示す．
anonymous block
contains any arbitrary component-level unit of text, acting as an anonymous container for phrase or inter level elements analogous to, but without the semantic baggage of, a paragraph.
任意の部分的テキスト単位を示す．特定の意味はなくとも，段落に相当する， 句レベル・挿入レベルの単位として無名単位になる．
@part
specifies whether or not the block is complete.
当該部分の完全性を示す．
yes
the block is incomplete
当該部分は完全ででない．
no
either the block is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness
当該部分は完全である，または完全性が問題にならない．
initial
the initial part of an incomplete block
当該部分の，前部分が完全ではない．
medial
a medial part of an incomplete block
当該部分の，中部分が完全ではない．
final
the final part of an incomplete block
当該部分の，後部分が完全ではない．
alternation
identifies an alternation or a set of choices among elements or passages.
要素などが選択的である場合のいち選択肢を示す．
@targets
specifies the identifiers of the alternative elements or passages.
当該選択肢の識別子を示す．
@mode
states whether the alternations gathered in this collection are exclusive or inclusive.
示された選択肢の選択度を示す．
exclusive
indicates that the alternation is exclusive, i.e. that at most one of the alternatives occurs.
高々ひとつしか選択できない．
inclusive
indicates that the alternation is not exclusive, i.e. that one or more of the alternatives occur.
複数を選択できる．
@weights

If mode is excl, each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs. If mode is incl each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs given that at least one of the other alternatives occurs.
属性modeの値がexclの場合，該当する選択肢 の出現度を示す． 属性modeの値がinclの場合，該当する選択肢の 少なくとも1つが出現する場合の出現度を示す．
alternation group
groups a collection of alt elements and possibly pointers.
要素altまたはポインタ要素ptrをまとめる．
@mode
states whether the alternations gathered in this collection are exclusive or inclusive.
当該要素でまとめられたものの，選択度を示す．
exclusive
indicates that the alternation is exclusive, i.e. that at most one of the alternatives occurs.
高々ひとつしか選択できない．
inclusive
indicates that the alternation is not exclusive, i.e. that one or more of the alternatives occur.
複数を選択できる．
anchor point
attaches an identifier to a point within a text, whether or not it corresponds with a textual element.
テキスト要素であるかどうかに関係なく，テキスト中で，参照先になるIDを 示す．
identifies a possibly fragmented segment of text, by pointing at the possibly discontiguous elements which compose it.
バラバラにあるテキスト部分を参照し，ひとつのテキスト部分を指定する．
@targets
specifies the identifiers of the elements or passages to be joined into a virtual element.
仮想要素へとまとめられる要素または一節の識別子を示す．
@result
specifies the name of an element which this aggregation may be understood to represent.
当該要素によりまとめられる要素名を示す．
@scope
indicates whether the targets to be joined include the entire element indicated (the entire subtree including its root), or just the children of the target (the branches of the subtree).
まとめられる対象が，要素全体(すなわち当該要素をルートとする部分 木全体)，またはその子要素(すなわち部分木の枝)であるかどうかを示 す．
the rooted subtrees indicated by the targets attribute are joined, each subtree become a child of the virtual element created by the join
属性で示された根付き部分木がまとめられ，各部分木は，当該要素 で作られた仮想要素の子となる．
the children of the subtrees indicated by the targets attribute become the children of the virtual element (i.e. the roots of the subtrees are discarded)
属性で示された部分木の子は，仮想要素の子となる(すなわち，当 該部分木の根は捨てられる．
join group
groups a collection of join elements and possibly pointers.
要素joinやポインタをまとめる．
@result
describes the result of the joins gathered in this collection.
当該要素でまとめられた要素joinを示す．
defines an association or hypertextual link among elements or passages, of some type not more precisely specifiable by other elements.
他の要素では上手く示せない，要素や一節間にある関連性やハイパーテキス トリンクを定義する．
@targets
specifies the identifiers of the elements or passages to be linked or associated.
リンク付けされれている当該要素または一節の識別子を示す．
link group
defines a collection of associations or hypertextual links.
関連性やハイパーテキストリンクの集合を定義する．
arbitrary segment
represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level.
任意の句レベルのテキスト単位を示す(要素segを含む)．
@subtype
provides a sub-categorization of the segment marked.
符号化された部分の下位範疇を示す．
timeline
provides a set of ordered points in time which can be linked to elements of a spoken text to create a temporal alignment of that text.
時間的なまとまりを示すために，発話テキストの要素をリンクすることがで きる，時間軸上の順序付き時点の集合を示す．
@origin
designates the origin of the timeline, i.e. the time at which it begins.
時間軸の起点示す．すなわち，始点の時間．
@unit
specifies the unit of time corresponding to the interval value of the timeline or of its constituent points in time.
時間軸を構成する属性intervalの値に対応する，時間単位 を特定する．
days
hours
minutes
seconds
milliseconds
@interval
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval
間隔を表す数値を示す．
indicates a point in time either relative to other elements in the same timeline tag, or absolutely.
同じ要素timeline中にある他の要素に対応する時点，または絶対 的な時点を示す．
@absolute
supplies an absolute value for the time.
当該時点の，絶対時間を示す．
@unit
specifies the unit of time in which the interval value is expressed, if this is not inherited from the parent timeline.
親要素timeLineから継承されない場合，属性 intervalで示される時間の単位を示す．
days
hours
minutes
seconds
milliseconds
@interval
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval
時間幅を数値で示す．
@since
identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point.
当該要素whenの時間となる参照時点を示す．参照時点に時間 幅を足すことで得られる．
provides additional global attributes for associating specific analyses or interpretations with appropriate portions of a text.
任意のテキスト部分への分析・解釈に関連するグローバル属性を示す．
@ana
analysis
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.
属性anaを伴う要素の解釈を含む要素を示す．
provides additional global attributes for associating specific analyses or interpretations with appropriate portions of a text.
任意のテキスト部分への分析・解釈に関連するグローバル属性を示す．
@ana
analysis
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.
属性anaを伴う要素の解釈を含む要素を示す．
character
represents a character.
文字を示す．
clause
represents a grammatical clause.
言語学上の節を示す．
interpretation
summarizes a specific interpretative annotation which can be linked to a span of text.
あるテキスト部分とリンクする，特定の解釈的注釈をまとめる．
interpretation group
collects together a set of related interpretations which share responsibility or type.
責任者や分類を共にする，関連し合う解釈をまとめる．
morpheme
represents a grammatical morpheme.
言語学上の形態素を示す．
@baseForm
identifies the morpheme's base form.
形態素の基形を示す．
phrase
represents a grammatical phrase.
文法上の句を示す．
s-unit
contains a sentence-like division of a text.
文に相当するテキスト単位を示す．
associates an interpretative annotation directly with a span of text.
テキスト部分に解釈的注釈を関連づける．
@from
specifies the beginning of the passage being annotated; if not accompanied by a to attribute, then specifies the entire passage.
当該注釈対象の始点を示す．属性toがない場合は，対象全 体を示す．
@to
specifies the end of the passage being annotated.
注釈対象の終点を示す．
span group
collects together span tags.
要素spanをまとめる．
word
represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word.
文法上の語を示す(正書形である必要はない)．
@lemma
provides a lemma for the word, such as an uninflected dictionary entry form.
当該語の，辞書の見出し形を示す．
@lemmaRef
provides a pointer to a definition for the root form of this word form.

cell.hi: No ja for "provides a pointer to a definition for the root form of this word form."

row.cell: bi-conditional feature-structure constraint

defines a biconditional feature-structure constraint; both consequent and antecedent are specified as feature structures or groups of feature structures; the constraint is satisfied if both subsume a given feature structure, or if both do not.
素性構造の制約を必要十分条件として定義する．前提部と帰結部は，素性構 造またはそのグループとして定義される．当該制約は，与えられた2つの素 性構造が共に真であるか，またはともに偽である場合に，真になる．
binary value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which can contain either of exactly two possible values.
二値として，素性値を示す．
@value
supplies a binary value.
二値で値を示す．
conditional feature-structure constraint

defines a conditional feature-structure constraint; the consequent and the antecedent are specified as feature structures or feature-structure collections; the constraint is satisfied if both the antecedent and the consequent subsume a given feature structure, or if the antecedent does not.
素性構造の条件制約を定義する．前提部と帰結部は，素性構造として定義さ れている．前提部と帰結部が共に真であったとき，または前提部が偽であっ たときに，当該条件節は真となる．
default feature value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a defaulted value.
素性値定義の既定値を示す
feature
represents a feature value specification, that is, the association of a name with a value of any of several different types.
素性値定義を示す．すなわち，素性名とその様々な値を示す．
@name
provides a name for the feature.
当該素性の名前を示す．
@fVal
feature value
references any element which can be used to represent the value of a feature.
素性値を表す要素を参照する．
feature declaration
declares a single feature, specifying its name, organization, range of allowed values, and optionally its default value.
ひとつの素性を宣言する．名前，構造，定義域，デフォルト値など．
@name
indicates the name of the feature being declared; matches the name attribute of f elements in the text.
素性の名前を示す．要素fの属性nameと一致する もの．
@optional
indicates whether or not the value of this feature may be present.
当該素性値があるかどうかを示す．
feature description (in FSD)
describes in prose what is represented by the feature being declared and its values.
当該素性により示されるものを，散文で示す．
feature library
assembles a library of feature elements.
素性に関する要素のライブラリをまとめる．
feature structure
represents a feature structure, that is, a collection of feature-value pairs organized as a structural unit.
素性構造を示す．すなわち，構造単位となる素性名-素性値の 組の集合．
@type
specifies the type of the feature structure.
当該素性構造の種類を示す．
@feats
features
references the feature-value specifications making up this feature structure.
当該素性構造を構成する素性定義を参照する．
feature-structure constraints
specifies constraints on the content of valid feature structures.
妥当な素性構造の内容に課す制約を示す．
feature structure declaration
declares one type of feature structure.
ひとつの素性構造を宣言する．
@type
gives a name for the type of feature structure being declared.
宣言された素性構造の名前を示す．
@baseTypes

gives the name of one or more typed feature structures from which this type inherits feature specifications and constraints; if this type includes a feature specification with the same name as that of any of those specified by this attribute, or if more than one specification of the same name is inherited, then the set of possible values is defined by unification. Similarly, the set of constraints applicable is derived by combining those specified explicitly within this element with those implied by the baseTypes attribute. When no baseTypes attribute is specified, no feature specification or constraint is inherited.
ひとつ以上の素性構造を示す．ここから，属性typeは素性定義・制約を 継承する．属性typeが当該属性で示されたものと同名の素性定義を含む 場合，またはひとつ以上の同名素性定義を継承する場合，それらの値は 統合される．同様に，当該属性baseTypesにある値と，当該 要素が持つ内容を統合して制約となる．属性baseTypeが付 与されていない場合，継承される素性定義や素性制約はない．
feature system description (in FSD)
describes in prose what is represented by the type of feature structure declared in the enclosing fsDecl.
要素fsDeclで定義される素性構造の内容を，散文で示す．
feature system declaration
provides a feature system declaration comprising one or more feature structure declarations or feature structure declaration links.
ひとつ以上の素性構造宣言または素性構造宣言へのリンクを含む，素性シス テム宣言を示す．
feature structure declaration link

cell.hi: No ja for "feature structure declaration link"

row.cell: associates the name of a typed feature structure with a feature structure declaration for it.
素性構造宣言により素性構造の名前を示す．
@type
解説される素性構造を示す．少なくともひとつの素性構造に関する属性 typeの値が付与される．
@target
supplies a pointer to a feature structure declaration (fsDecl) element within the current document or elsewhere.
素性構造宣言要素(fsDecl)へのポインタが示される．
feature-value library
assembles a library of reusable feature value elements (including complete feature structures).
再利用が可能な素性値をライブラリとしてまとめる．
defines a conditional default value for a feature; the condition is specified as a feature structure, and is met if it subsumes the feature structure in the text for which a default value is sought.
素性の条件におけるデフォルト値を定義する．当該値には，素性構造が指定 される．
if and only if

cell.hi: No ja for "if and only if"

row.cell: separates the condition from the consequence in a bicond element.
必要十分条件における前提部と帰結部の区切を示す．
numeric value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a numeric value or range.
素性値定義における値を示す．
@value
supplies a lower bound for the numeric value represented, and also (if max is not supplied) its upper bound.
与えられている数値の下限を示す．または，(属性maxが付 与されていない場合には)値の上限を示す．
@max
supplies an upper bound for the numeric value represented.
与えられている数値の上限を示す．
@trunc
specifies whether the value represented should be truncated to give an integer value.
当該数値が整数値へ丸められるかどうかを示す．
string value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a string.
素性値規定において，値として文字列をとる値の部分を示す．
symbolic value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains one of a finite list of symbols.
記号リスト中のいち項目を含む素性値規定のうち，値の部分を示す．
@value
supplies the symbolic value for the feature, one of a finite list that may be specified in a feature declaration.
当該組成の記号値を示す．素性宣言のリスト中にあるいち項目になる．
separates the condition from the default in an if, or the antecedent and the consequent in a cond element.
要素if中のデフォルト値と条件部，または要素cond中の 前提部と帰結部を区切る．
value alternation
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a set of values, only one of which can be valid.
素性値規定において，妥当なひとつの値を表す，値の部分を示す．
collection of values
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains multiple values organized as a set, bag, or list.
素性値規定において，複数の値を，集合，バック，リストなどで表す，値の 部分を示す．
@org
organization
indicates organization of given value or values as set, bag or list.
付与された値，または，集合，バッグ，リストとしてある値の構造を示 す．
indicates that the given values are organized as a set.
集合(順序なし，重複なし)としてある値を示す．
indicates that the given values are organized as a bag (multiset).
バック(順序なし，重複あり)としてある値を示す．
indicates that the given values are organized as a list.
リスト(順序あり，重複あり)としてある値を示す．
value default

declares the default value to be supplied when a feature structure does not contain an instance of f for this name; if unconditional, it is specified as one (or, depending on the value of the org attribute of the enclosing fDecl) more fs elements or primitive values; if conditional, it is specified as one or more if elements; if no default is specified, or no condition matches, the value none is assumed.
素性構造が要素fを持たないときのデフォルト値を宣言する．条件 的でない場合，要素fsまたは値がもうひとつ(または，要素 fDeclにある属性orgの値に依存する数だけ)付与される．条件的な 場合，要素であればひとつ以上が付与される．デフォルト値が指定されてい ない場合，または条件が成立しない場合は，値noneをとるする．
value label
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which appears at more than one point in a feature structure.
素性構造中，複数箇所に現れる，素性値規定の値の部分を示す．
@name
supplies a name for the sharing point.
共有ポイントの場所を示す．
merged collection of values
represents a feature value which is the result of merging together the feature values contained by its children, using the organization specified by the org attribute.
属性orgで示された構造を使い，子要素が持つ値とマージした結 果得られた素性値を示す．
@org
indicates the organization of the resulting merged values as set, bag or list.
構造値をマージした結果の構造を示す．例えば，集合，バック，リスト など．
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a set.
結果として得られた値の構造が，集合(順序なし，重複なし)である ことを示す．
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a bag (multiset).
結果として得られた値の構造が，バック(順序なし，重複あり)であ ることを示す．
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a list.
結果として得られた値の構造が，リスト(順序あり，重複あり)であ ることを示す．
value negation
represents a feature value which is the negation of its content.
当該要素の内容の否定する素性値を示す．
value range

defines the range of allowed values for a feature, in the form of an fs, vAlt, or primitive value; for the value of an f to be valid, it must be subsumed by the specified range; if the f contains multiple values (as sanctioned by the org attribute), then each value must be subsumed by the vRange.
要素fs, vAltで示される素性値の範囲を定義する．要素 fの妥当な値は，その範囲内になければならない．要素f が複数の値をとる場合(属性orgがそれを認めている時)，各値は当該要素 vRangeが示す範囲内になければならない．
encodes an arc, the connection from one node to another in a graph.
グラフを構成するノード間の辺を示す．
@from
gives the identifier of the node which is adjacent from this arc.
当該辺が有向である場合，起点となるノードを示す．
@to
gives the identifier of the node which is adjacent to this arc.
当該辺が有効である場合，終点となるノードを示す．
leaf or terminal node of an embedding tree
provides explicitly for a leaf of an embedding tree, which may also be encoded with the eTree element.
部分木における葉を示す．要素eTree中で使用される．
@value
provides the value of an embedding leaf, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.
部分木の葉の値を示す．この葉は，素性構造または他の分析に関する要 素である．
embedding tree
provides an alternative to tree element for representing ordered rooted tree structures.
順序付き根付き木を構成する部分木を示す．
@value
provides the value of an embedding tree, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.
当該部分木の値を示す．素性構造または他の分析に関する要素になる．
provides for groups of rooted trees.
根付き木のの集合を示す．
@type
identifies the type of the forest.
当該森の種類を示す．
forest group
provides for groups of forests.
森の集合を示す．
@type
identifies the type of the forest group.
当該森集合の種類を示す．
encodes a graph, which is a collection of nodes, and arcs which connect the nodes.
グラフを示す．ノードと矢(無向の場合は辺)の集合．
@type
describes the type of graph.
当該グラフの種類を示す．
undirected graph
無向グラフ．
directed graph
有向グラフ．
a directed graph with distinguished initial and final nodes
遷移ネットワーク．初期ノードと最終ノードを分けた有向グラフ．
a transition network with up to two labels on each arc
トランスデューサ．各矢に高々2つのラベルを持つ遷移ネットワーク．
@order
states the order of the graph, i.e., the number of its nodes.
当該グラフのオーダー．グラフに含まれるノード数を示す．
@size
states the size of the graph, i.e., the number of its arcs.
当該グラフのサイズ．グラフに含まれる辺数を示す．
intermediate (or internal) node
represents an intermediate (or internal) node of a tree.
木における内部ノードを示す．
@value
provides the value of an intermediate node, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.
内部ノードの値を示す．素性構造向け要素または分析向け要素になる．
@children
provides a list of identifiers of the elements which are the children of the intermediate node.
当該内部ノードの子要素の識別子をまとめたリストを示す．
@parent
provides the identifier of the element which is the parent of this node.
当該ノードの親要素の識別子を示す．
@ord
ordered
indicates whether or not the internal node is ordered.
当該内部ノードが順序付きかどうかを示す．
@follow
provides an identifier of the element which this node follows.
当該ノードの姉要素の識別子を示す．
@outDegree
gives the out degree of an intermediate node, the number of its children.
内部ノードの出の次数(子要素の数)を示す．
encodes the leaves (terminal nodes) of a tree.
木(構造)における葉(終端ノード)を示す．
@value
provides a pointer to a feature structure or other analytic element.
素性構造または他の分析要素へのポインタを示す．
@parent
provides the identifier of parent of a leaf.
葉の親要素の識別子を示す．
@follow
provides an identifier of an element which this leaf follows.
当該葉の姉要素の識別子を示す．
encodes a node, a possibly labeled point in a graph.
グラフのラベル付きノードを示す．
@value
provides the value of a node, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.
ノードの値を示す．これは，素性構造または他の分析要素である．
@type
provides a type for a node.
ノードの種類を示す．
initial node in a transition network
遷移ネットワークの初期ノード．
final node in a transition network
遷移ネットワークの最終ノード．
@adjTo
adjacent to
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent to the current node.
有向グラフにおける，現行ノードに入るノードの識別子を示す．
@adjFrom
adjacent from
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent from the current node.
有向グラフにおける，現行ノードから出るノードの識別子を示す．
@adj
adjacent
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are both adjacent to and adjacent from the current node.
無向グラフにおける，現行ノードに隣接するノードの識別子を示す．
@inDegree
gives the in degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent from the given node.
現行ノードの入りの次数．すなわち，ノードへ入る辺の数．
@outDegree
gives the out degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent to the given node.
現行ノードの出の次数．すなわち，ノードから出る辺の数．
@degree
gives the degree of the node, the number of arcs with which the node is incident.
当該ノードの次数．すなわち，ノードにある辺の数．
root node
represents the root node of a tree.
木の根要素を示す．
@value
provides the value of the root, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.
当該根要素の値絵お示す．これは，素性構造または他の分析要素となる．
@children
provides a list of identifiers of the elements which are the children of the root node.
当該根要素の子要素となる要素の識別子のリストを示す．
@ord
ordered
indicates whether or not the root is ordered.
当該根要素が，順序付きかどうかを示す．
@outDegree
gives the out degree of the root, the number of its children.
当該根要素の出の次数，すなわち子要素の数を示す．
encodes a tree, which is made up of a root, internal nodes, leaves, and arcs from root to leaves.
根，内部ノード，葉，矢(または辺)から成る木を示す．
@arity
gives the maximum number of children of the root and internal nodes of the tree.
木構造における，根や内部ノードが持つ子供の最大数を示す．
@ord
ordered
indicates whether or not the tree is ordered, or if it is partially ordered.
当該木構造が，順序付き木，または半順序付き木であるかどうかを示す．
indicates that all of the branching nodes of the tree are ordered.
木構造中の全ノードは，順序付きであることを示す．
indicates that some of the branching nodes of the tree are ordered and some are unordered.
木構造中のノードの一部は順序付きであるが，一部は順序付きでは ないことを示す．
indicates that all of the branching nodes of the tree are unordered.
木構造の全ノードは，順序付きではないことを示す．
@order
gives the order of the tree, i.e., the number of its nodes.
木構造の順番を示す．例えば，ノードの番号を示す．
underspecified embedding tree, so called because of its characteristic shape when drawn
Provides for an underspecified eTree, that is, an eTree with information left out.
未定義の部分木(eTree)，すなわち情報が付与されていない部分木を示す．
@value
provides the value of a triangle, which is the identifier of a feature structure or other analytic element.
省略部分木の値を示す．素性構造または他の分析要素の識別子になる．
indicates the degree of certainty or uncertainty associated with some aspect of the text markup.
当該マークアップの確信度を示す．
@target
points at the elements whose markup is uncertain.
確信度の対象となる要素を示す．
@locus
indicates the precise location of the uncertainty in the markup: applicability of the element, precise position of the start- or end-tag, value of a specific attribute, etc.
当該確信度が該当する場所の詳細を示す．例えば，要素全体，開始タグ または終了タグの正確な位置，特定属性の値，など．
element name
uncertain whether the element used actually applies to the passage.
要素全体に対する不確かさ．
start location
start-tag may not be correctly located.
開始タグに対する不確かさ．
end location
end-tag may not be correctly located.
終了タグに対する不確かさ．
both the start-tag and the end-tag may not be correctly located.
開始タグ・終了タグの両方に対する不確かさ．
attribute name
the value given for the attribute name is uncertain.
当該属性の値に対する不確かさ．
the content of the element may not be a correct transcription of the source text.
当該要素の内容は，元テキストからの正しい転記ではないかもしれ ない．
the content of the element may not have been correctly supplied by the reader, e.g. as in the cases of corr and abbrev elements.
当該要素の内容は，利用者から正しく付与されていないかもしれな い．例えば，要素corrやabbrevが付与されている場合．
@assertedValue

provides an alternative value for the aspect of the markup in question—an alternative generic identifier, transcription, or attribute value, or the identifier of an anchor element (to indicate an alternative starting or ending location). If an assertedValue is given, the confidence level specified by degree applies to the alternative markup specified by assertedValue; if none is given, it applies to the markup in the text.
懸案の部分に対する代替値を示す．例えば，共通識別子(GI)，転記，属 性値，(他の開始・終了地点を示す)要素anchorの識別子，な ど．属性assertedValueがある場合，属性 degreeで定義された確信度は，属性 assertedValueにある値への確信度を示す． 何もない場合には，当該テキスト中の当該マークアップに該当する．
@given
indicates conditions assumed in the assignment of a degree of confidence.
当該確信度が成立する条件を示す．
@degree
indicates the degree of confidence assigned to the aspect of the markup named by the locus attribute.
属性locusで示された対象のに付与される確信度の程度を示 す．

responsibility for the transcription of the element content

responsibility for the contents supplied by the encoder (corrections, expansions of abbreviations, etc.)
責任は，符号化する人が付加した内容(校正，略語の展開など)にあ る．

documents the structure, content, and purpose of a single module, i.e. a named and externally visible group of declarations.

contains any commentary or discussion about the usage of an element, attribute, class, or entity not otherwise documented within the containing element.
要素，属性，クラス，エンティティに関する，まだ文書化されていない解説 や論議を示す．

当該スキーマの開始点を示す．すなわち，TEI準拠文書の根要素となる 要素を示す．

当該スキーマで使用されるデフォルトの名前空間を示す．

specifies a prefix which will be appended to all patterns relating to TEI elements. This allows for external schemas to be mixed in which have elements of the same names as the TEI.

specifies which language to use when creating the objects in a schema if names for elements or attributes are available in more than one language, .
要素や属性の名前が複数言語である場合には，スキーマ中の対象を作成 する際に使用される言語を特定する．

specifies which languages to use when creating documentation if the description for an element, attribute, class or macro is available in more than one language, .
要素，属性，クラス，マクロの解説が複数言語で可能な場合，解説の言 語を特定する．
